metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1851 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Cinder before 2014.1.5 (icehouse), 2014.2.x before 2014.2.4 (juno), and 2015.1.x before 2015.1.1 (kilo) allows remote authenticated users to read arbitrary files via a crafted qcow2 signature in an image to the upload-to-image command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cinder-api - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
cinder-backup - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
cinder-common - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
cinder-scheduler - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
cinder-volume - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
python-cinder - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> not going to be fixed before 14.10 goes EoL

criterions.comment: cinder package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1').
